channel.title: How to Make a Scoreboard That Shows Top 10 Pkers
channel.description: Ok so i have coded a bunch and i made a scoreboard to show the the top 10 players with the best total skill levels. now i want to change ti because i removed some skills ad i want to make it the top Pkers. On the scoreboard i want it to either display the players kills or the players kdr's. and yes i have a command to show the players kdr if that helps. If you can help me with this i would greatly appreciate ti! also i have teamviewer incase you just want to do it for me :))) thanks alot!!! - fluffy

item.title: How to Make a Scoreboard That Shows Top 10 Pkers
item.dc:creator: @Fluffys Fluffys
item.description:
@Fluffys wrote:

can you do it for me on teamviewer? i tried adding it and it came up with like 53 errors. i cant figure it out. ill pay you $1 lol paypal.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Make a Scoreboard That Shows Top 10 Pkers
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Fluffys:

so just go to client.java and search for firstclickobject and under it add this code? for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {

Go to whatever class has your firstclickobject (actionhandler if using pi) and you add that with the kc code to print onto the shown interface when you click that object.

item.title: How to Make a Scoreboard That Shows Top 10 Pkers
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Fluffys, post:5, topic:438538”]Here is my KDR command. and it works perfectly when i type ::kdr ingame.

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“kdr”)) {
double KDR = ((double)c.KC)/((double)c.DC);
c.forcedChat(“My Kill/Death ratio is “+c.KC+”/”+c.DC+"; “+KDR+”.");
}[/quote]

Ok, so what that is saying is if their command starts with kdr it’ll do the following:

KDR is equal to KC/DC. (cast with a double for decimals, should use floats, they use half the memory)

Then it makes the player say: “My kill/death ratio is KC/DC; KDR.”

So, to do this on the board get the firstclickobject and put in this code, except for one player, you’ll have to do a loop through all online players. To do that you can use a basic loop

for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {

Read full topic
item.source: How to Make a Scoreboard That Shows Top 10 Pkers

item.title: How to Make a Scoreboard That Shows Top 10 Pkers
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Fluffys, post:5, topic:438538”]Here is my KDR command. and it works perfectly when i type ::kdr ingame.

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“kdr”)) {
double KDR = ((double)c.KC)/((double)c.DC);
c.forcedChat(“My Kill/Death ratio is “+c.KC+”/”+c.DC+"; “+KDR+”.");
}[/quote]
This command only is for one player, the one doing the command,
you will have to make it loop through all players online, take a look to commands that do this already.

Read full topic

That makes my eyes bleed.

[ code ] and [ / code ] (remove spaces) then put the code in there.

What exactly do you have now for the KDR command? C&P from source.

item.title: How to Make a Scoreboard That Shows Top 10 Pkers
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Using the method you have that shows the player’s KDR, have that loop through and select the highest kdr (up to 10) and then print the results. Have that print shown on the interface.
